taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family Polygonaceae;subfamily Eriogonoideae;genus Eriogonum;species ovalifolium;variety eximium;

bio:treatment.discussion: Variety eximium is known only from the Carson Range in Carson City, Douglas, and Washoe counties, Nevada, and from the Jobâ€™s Peak area of Alpine County, California. The Slide Mountain wild buckwheat morphologically approaches higher-elevation pop-ulations of var. nivale in the Carson Range, and the edaphically restricted var. williamsiae from Steamboat Springs. In addition, there is a series of populations in Siskiyou County, California, which approaches var. eximium. At this time, a definite disposition of those northern California populations has not been made. On infrequent occasions, the distinct brown leaf-blade margins are absent from individuals within an otherwise normal population. The variety is an ideal rock-garden plant, although it is slow to grow to the size seen in the field.
